item.title: Amir add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Amir add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amir add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Amir add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amir add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already 3-parts dead." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "In all affairs it's a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Everything is vague to a degree you do not realize till you have tried to make it precise." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I do not pretend to be able to prove that there is no God. I equally cannot prove that Satan is a fiction. The Christian god may exist; so may the gods of Olympus, or of ancient Egypt, or of Babylon. But no one of these hypotheses is more probable than any other: they lie outside the region of even probable knowledge, and therefore there is no reason to consider any of them." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "We know very little, and yet it is astonishing that we know so much, and still more astonishing that so little knowledge can give us so much power." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Amir add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amir add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein
